title: Make AI Proficiency a Condition of Employment
insight: Optional AI adoption creates bimodal distribution (power users and non-users). Making proficiency mandatory—with support structures—creates universal capability.
manifestations: Shopify: 'Prove AI can't do it before requesting headcount'; AI usage affects performance reviews
Moderna: 100% AI proficiency target within 6 months
Palo Alto Networks: 2,500 developers on Claude Code, 70% faster junior onboarding
BCG Trailblazers: 60% of AI budget to workforce upskilling (vs. 24-27% for followers)
test: What percentage of employees use AI tools weekly? If under 50%, adoption is optional in practice regardless of policy. What happens to employees who refuse to adopt?
